page.title: 11INDUSTRY
page.content: The Forestry Commission from their centre at Tangham, administer the only work in this area which could be termed industrial. A staff of 38 is employed, 26 industrials and 12 non- industrials, who belong, voluntarily, to either the T.& G.W.U. or their res- pective Civil Service union. The crop of 30,000 tonnes of timber produced annually is mainly Scots and Corsican pine. Hopson Timber Co. of Great Yarmouth & Nelson Potter of Hollesley take about 70% of the sawn-log element of production, for use by the const- ruction industry, in shoring timber for mines, and pallets. The remaining small roundwood is exported to Sweden for pulping (which is re-imported for paper making).Waste bark from the saw- mills has horticultural and equestrian use.
